intro: Lachenalia tricolor var. nelsonii, commonly known as the Nelson's three-color lachenalia, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen rosette of fleshy, blue-green leaves. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, three-colored flowers in shades of white, yellow, and pink during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value and unique floral display, it is often cultivated by succulent enthusiasts.
